Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Navigation
  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    The Navigation class is used to make the robot navigate around the playing field.

    • Method Detail

      • doLap

        public static void doLap​(java.util.List<ca.mcgill.ecse211.playingfield.Point> waypoints)
        Perform 1 lap, where the track is a combination of all the waypoints. Drives from the first waypoint in the list to the last waypoint in the list. This method calls an overpass handling method for driving over the overpass and also accounts for obstacle avoidance. Then it goes back to the first waypoint and moves back to the starting point.
        Parameters:
        waypoints - : A list of all the waypoints the robot must travel to

      • crossingTunnel

        public static void crossingTunnel​(int startingCorner)
        Using the starting corner to cross the tunnel using a helper method and set the odometer. Divides the field into 4 different starting corner and crosses the tunnel from each corner.
        Parameters:
        startingCorner - The starting corner of the robot.

      • moveBackToStart

        public static void moveBackToStart​(ca.mcgill.ecse211.playingfield.Point start,
                                   ca.mcgill.ecse211.playingfield.Point wayPoint)
        Traveling back from the waypoint to the starting point. The robot crosses the tunnel and goes back to the starting point.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting point of the robot.
        wayPoint - The first waypoint

      • getStartingPoint

        public static ca.mcgill.ecse211.playingfield.Point getStartingPoint​(int corner)
        Given the robots' starting corner, return the actual point of the robots' starting corner before the robot has localized.
        Parameters:
        corner - wifi parameter indicating the robots' starting corner.
        Returns:

      • travelTo

        public static void travelTo​(ca.mcgill.ecse211.playingfield.Point destination)
        Travels to specific destination depending on whether the orientation of the robot is correct and whether the path is obstacle free. Turns the robot toward the destination by minimal angle. Takes the green zone and the red zone into account when it wants to travel. It considers 5 different cases: Case 1: We're already at the destination. Case 2: We're facing the right way. Case 3: We have to turn.
        Parameters:
        destination - the destination point

      • directTravelTo

        public static void directTravelTo​(ca.mcgill.ecse211.playingfield.Point destination)
        Takes a point and moves directly toward it without concerning about the obstacles.
        Parameters:
        destination -

      • slowDirectTravelTo

        public static void slowDirectTravelTo​(ca.mcgill.ecse211.playingfield.Point destination)
        Takes a point and moves directly and slowly toward it without concerning about the obstacles.
        Parameters:
        destination -

      • turnTo

        public static void turnTo​(double angle)
        Turns the robot with a minimal angle towards the given input angle in degrees, no matter what its current orientation is. This method is different from turnBy().

      • getDestinationAngle

        public static double getDestinationAngle​(ca.mcgill.ecse211.playingfield.Point current,

        Parameters:

        destination - Destination point
        Returns:
        the destination angle

        Returns:

        Takes current point and destination points and compare them. If the difference is less than the tolerance returns true
        Parameters:

        destination - Destination point
        tolerance - Tolerated difference
        Returns:
        true if points are the close
